John A. Kunze wrote:
> --- On Thu, 23 Feb 2006, stack wrote:
> > ...
> >
> > Since then we've added a public 'remote control' API available via JMX.
> > I'd suggest you use the API since it is more immune to change (Least,
> > we'll be more careful making changes on this interface.  Services
> > running here at the Archive depend on it being constant so we're even
> > less likely to change it).
>
> Hi Michael,
>
> We've been putting JMX through some paces and found areas where embedding
> appears to give us functionality that may be more smoothly obtained than
> with JMX.  It may due to our limited understanding, but some of the JMX
> reporting and job control stuff was feeling a little clunky.
Marshalling and unmarshalling for JMX and rolling/unrolling OpenMBeans 
is for sure clunky.  This project, http://crawler.archive.org/hcc/, 
tries to smooth things some, especially for those trying to manage a 
gaggle of remote crawlers.

That said, we're gasping for feedback on current JMX API.
>
> Before asking you anything substantive, I'd like to work up a better
> statement of my thinking, and I'm wondering if in the meantime you all
> have started a wishlist of proposed enhancements to JMX.
>
A while back I petitioned for suggestions on what to add to JMX API 
(Here is the posting: 
http://groups.yahoo.com/group/archive-crawler/message/1842). The 
petition may have been premature.  Since its basically working -- you 
can't add/remove/reorder filters/processors or add overrides but you can 
effect most other attributes of a running crawl, etc. -- thought is that 
requests for enhancements to JMX API should now just get filed as you 
would any other request, as an RFE against Heritrix.  A few minor ones 
are all that currently exist. 

You thinking something substantial John?

The ultimate goal is that all control goes via the one interface whether 
the local web UI or a remote cluster controller passing the config.to 
all members of a Heritrix crawling cluster.

St.Ack
